Then answered the Lord unto Job out of the whirlwind, and said,
And the Lord turned the captivity of Job, when he prayed for his friends: also the Lord gave Job twice as much as he had before.
So Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went, and did according as the Lord commanded them: the Lord also accepted Job.

verses.text: Shall he that contendeth with the Almighty instruct him? he that reproveth God, let him answer it.

similars.text: So shall I have wherewith to answer him that reproacheth me: for I trust in thy word.
Surely I would speak to the Almighty, and I desire to reason with God.
Should it be according to thy mind? he will recompense it, whether thou refuse, or whether thou choose; and not I: therefore speak what thou knowest.
Will ye accept his person? will ye contend for God?

And he that will contend against the word of the Lord, let him be accursed; and he that shall deny these things, let him be accursed; for unto them will I show no greater things, saith Jesus Christ; for I am he who speaketh.
What then shall I do when God riseth up? and when he visiteth, what shall I answer him?
And he answered: Nay; Lord, show thyself unto me.
If thou wouldest seek unto God betimes, and make thy supplication to the Almighty;

Then I answered them, The word of the Lord came unto me, saying,

verses.text: Behold, I am vile; what shall I answer thee? I will lay mine hand upon my mouth.

similars.text: For my mouth shall speak truth; and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
The wicked have waited for me to destroy me: but I will consider thy testimonies.
Thou art become cruel to me: with thy strong hand thou opposest thyself against me.
Let mine enemy be as the wicked, and he that riseth up against me as the unrighteous.
And I will cast abominable filth upon thee, and make thee vile, and will set thee as a gazingstock.

And it shall come to pass that whosoever shall lay their hands upon you by violence, ye shall command to be smitten in my name; and, behold, I will smite them according to your words, in mine own due time.
For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue.
Have mercy upon me, O God, according to thy lovingkindness: according unto the multitude of thy tender mercies blot out my transgressions.
O wretched man that I am! who shall deliver me from the body of this death?
The words of the wicked are to lie in wait for blood: but the mouth of the upright shall deliver them.

verses.text: Once have I spoken; but I will not answer: yea, twice; but I will proceed no further.

Then Job answered the Lord, and said,

verses.text: Gird up thy loins now like a man: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.

similars.text: Gird up now thy loins like a man; for I will demand of thee, and answer thou me.
Hear, I beseech thee, and I will speak: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.
Plead my cause, and deliver me: quicken me according to thy word.
Behold, verily, verily, I say unto you, I will declare unto you my doctrine.
And now, my brethren, I would speak unto you more; but on the morrow I will declare unto you the remainder of my words. Amen.
Turn you at my reproof: behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you.
Thou therefore gird up thy loins, and arise, and speak unto them all that I command thee: be not dismayed at their faces, lest I confound thee before them.
Behold, I, the Lord, utter my voice, and it shall be obeyed.
And men shall speak of the might of thy terrible acts: and I will declare thy greatness.
Thus saith the Lord God; I will yet for this be inquired of by the house of Israel, to do it for them; I will increase them with men like a flock.
Thou shalt call, and I will answer thee: thou wilt have a desire to the work of thine hands.

Seek not to declare my word, but first seek to obtain my word, and then shall your tongue be loosed; then, if you desire, you shall have my Spirit and my word, yea, the power of God unto the convincing of men.
I will declare the decree: the Lord hath said unto me, Thou art my Son; this day have I begotten thee.
Behold, I say unto you, go forth as I have commanded you; repent of all your sins; ask and ye shall receive; knock and it shall be opened unto you.
Put me in remembrance: let us plead together: declare thou, that thou mayest be justified.
Strangers shall submit themselves unto me: as soon as they hear, they shall be obedient unto me.
But thou, O Lord, be merciful unto me, and raise me up, that I may requite them.

And the Lord said unto me also: I will raise up unto the fruit of thy loins; and I will make for him a spokesman. And I, behold, I will give unto him that he shall write the writing of the fruit of thy loins, unto the fruit of thy loins; and the spokesman of thy loins shall declare it.
For I will promote thee unto very great honour, and I will do whatsoever thou sayest unto me: come therefore, I pray thee, curse me this people.
Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth, and lay up his words in thine heart.
For the oppression of the poor, for the sighing of the needy, now will I arise, saith the Lord; I will set him in safety from him that puffeth at him.

Now, I say unto you, my friends, let my servant Sidney Rigdon go on his journey, and make haste, and also proclaim the acceptable year of the Lord, and the gospel of salvation, as I shall give him utterance; and by your prayer of faith with one consent I will uphold him.
I will offer to thee the sacrifice of thanksgiving, and will call upon the name of the Lord.
Therefore we plead before thee for a full and complete deliverance from under this yoke;
Let my supplication come before thee: deliver me according to thy word.
I entreated thy favour with my whole heart: be merciful unto me according to thy word.
If ye shall ask any thing in my name, I will do it.
Behold, I speak unto you, and also to all those who have desires to bring forth and establish this work;
I am Jesus Christ, the Son of God; wherefore, gird up your loins and I will suddenly come to my temple. Even so. Amen.
Be merciful unto me, O God: for man would swallow me up; he fighting daily oppresseth me.

For ye dissembled in your hearts, when ye sent me unto the Lord your God, saying, Pray for us unto the Lord our God; and according unto all that the Lord our God shall say, so declare unto us, and we will do it.
Deal bountifully with thy servant, that I may live, and keep thy word.
For I will fulfil my promises which I have made unto the children of men, that I will do unto them while they are in the flesh--
Wherefore will ye plead with me? ye all have transgressed against me, saith the Lord.
And my soul delighteth in proving unto my people that save Christ should come all men must perish.
I opened my mouth, and panted: for I longed for thy commandments.
Gird up now thy loins like a man; for I will demand of thee, and answer thou me.
Gird up now thy loins like a man; for I will demand of thee, and answer thou me.
Hear, I beseech thee, and I will speak: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.

verses.text: Wilt thou also disannul my judgment? wilt thou condemn me, that thou mayest be righteous?

similars.text: O Lord, wilt thou redeem my soul? Wilt thou deliver me out of the hands of mine enemies? Wilt thou make me that I may shake at the appearance of sin?
If I sin, then thou markest me, and thou wilt not acquit me from mine iniquity.
The Lord said moreover unto me; Son of man, wilt thou judge Aholah and Aholibah? yea, declare unto them their abominations;
If thou therefore wilt worship me, all shall be thine.
Against thee, thee only, have I sinned, and done this evil in thy sight: that thou mightest be justified when thou speakest, and be clear when thou judgest.
He shall judge thy people with righteousness, and thy poor with judgment.
Righteous art thou, O Lord, and upright are thy judgments.
Therefore thou art inexcusable, O man, whosoever thou art that judgest: for wherein thou judgest another, thou condemnest thyself; for thou that judgest doest the same things.
Ye shall do no unrighteousness in judgment: thou shalt not respect the person of the poor, nor honour the person of the mighty: but in righteousness shalt thou judge thy neighbour.
Judge not, and ye shall not be judged: condemn not, and ye shall not be condemned: forgive, and ye shall be forgiven:
Remember, I beseech thee, that thou hast made me as the clay; and wilt thou bring me into dust again?
When he shall be judged, let him be condemned: and let his prayer become sin.
For thou, Lord, wilt bless the righteous; with favour wilt thou compass him as with a shield.
Judge me, O Lord my God, according to thy righteousness; and let them not rejoice over me.
With the pure thou wilt shew thyself pure; and with the froward thou wilt shew thyself unsavoury.
Wilt thou judge them, son of man, wilt thou judge them? cause them to know the abominations of their fathers:
For by thy words thou shalt be justified, and by thy words thou shalt be condemned.
Thou wilt say then unto me, Why doth he yet find fault? For who hath resisted his will?
Wilt thou refrain thyself for these things, O Lord? wilt thou hold thy peace, and afflict us very sore?
And if ye shall despise my statutes, or if your soul abhor my judgments, so that ye will not do all my commandments, but that ye break my covenant:
For he shall have judgment without mercy, that hath shewed no mercy; and mercy rejoiceth against judgment.
If thou wilt return, O Israel, saith the Lord, return unto me: and if thou wilt put away thine abominations out of my sight, then shalt thou not remove.
O Lord, correct me, but with judgment; not in thine anger, lest thou bring me to nothing.
How many are the days of thy servant? when wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?
Thou shalt not wrest the judgment of thy poor in his cause.

verses.text: Hast thou an arm like God? or canst thou thunder with a voice like him?
Deck thyself now with majesty and excellency; and array thyself with glory and beauty.

similars.text: I will speak of the glorious honour of thy majesty, and of thy wondrous works.

verses.text: Cast abroad the rage of thy wrath: and behold every one that is proud, and abase him.
Look on every one that is proud, and bring him low; and tread down the wicked in their place.

similars.text: Every one that is proud shall be thrust through; yea, and every one that is joined to the wicked shall fall by the sword.
For the day of the Lord of hosts shall be upon every one that is proud and lofty, and upon every one that is lifted up; and he shall be brought low:
Wherefore, all those who are proud, and that do wickedly, the day that cometh shall burn them up, saith the Lord of Hosts, for they shall be as stubble.

verses.text: Hide them in the dust together; and bind their faces in secret.

similars.text: Thou hidest thy face, they are troubled: thou takest away their breath, they die, and return to their dust.

verses.text: Then will I also confess unto thee that thine own right hand can save thee.

similars.text: That thy beloved may be delivered: save with thy right hand, and answer me.
Now know I that the Lord saveth his anointed; he will hear him from his holy heaven with the saving strength of his right hand.
That thy beloved may be delivered; save with thy right hand, and hear me.
For I the Lord thy God will hold thy right hand, saying unto thee, Fear not; I will help thee.
Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou wilt revive me: thou shalt stretch forth thine hand against the wrath of mine enemies, and thy right hand shall save me.
And now if ye will deal kindly and truly with my master, tell me: and if not, tell me; that I may turn to the right hand, or to the left.
That thy beloved may be delivered: save with thy right hand, and answer me.
Even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.

verses.text: Behold now behemoth, which I made with thee; he eateth grass as an ox.

similars.text: Thus they changed their glory into the similitude of an ox that eateth grass.

He that killeth an ox is as if he slew a man; he that sacrificeth a lamb, as if he cut off a dog's neck; he that offereth an oblation, as if he offered swine's blood; he that burneth incense, as if he blessed an idol. Yea, they have chosen their own ways, and their soul delighteth in their abominations.

verses.text: Lo now, his strength is in his loins, and his force is in the navel of his belly.
He moveth his tail like a cedar: the sinews of his stones are wrapped together.

similars.text: His roots are wrapped about the heap, and seeth the place of stones.

verses.text: His bones are as strong pieces of brass; his bones are like bars of iron.
He is the chief of the ways of God: he that made him can make his sword to approach unto him.
Surely the mountains bring him forth food, where all the beasts of the field play.

similars.text: The range of the mountains is his pasture, and he searcheth after every green thing.

verses.text: He lieth under the shady trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens.

similars.text: The shady trees cover him with their shadow; the willows of the brook compass him about.
The shady trees cover him with their shadow; the willows of the brook compass him about.

verses.text: The shady trees cover him with their shadow; the willows of the brook compass him about.

similars.text: He lieth under the shady trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens.
He lieth under the shady trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens.

verses.text: Behold, he drinketh up a river, and hasteth not: he trusteth that he can draw up Jordan into his mouth.
He taketh it with his eyes: his nose pierceth through snares.

similars.text: He shutteth his eyes to devise froward things: moving his lips he bringeth evil to pass.
